Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, excellent prices and...”
Reviews.Author: JetlagBrazil
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a little bit noisy. I could hear everything the guys in the room next door were talking. Nice service and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep here”
Reviews.Author: badcop
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a standard HI Express and okay as far as that goes. However, if you want to sleep after 7 am, don't stay here. The bedroom doors are cleverly designed so that they have to be slammed in order to close them and with the early morning travellers on the move the noise was horrendous. On top of that the housekeeping staff were screeching at each other from 8 am onwards, as well as continuing with the door slamming. Having arrived late at night, with a touch of jet lag, I was not impressed. For the smokers, this is a non-smoking hotel, although that is not made clear. I booked a room which was thrown up by a search for a smoking room here, on the HIExpress website, but in fact smoking rooms are non-existent. All in all, an unhappy experience, which I would not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “All New - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Nosmo_King1949
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently remodeled and looks like new. Has all standard Holiday Inn Express features. Breakfast was great. Free shuttle to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay at this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: MatildaC
Reviews.Content: The first night at the hotel was TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! First, they gave me a room when there's already someone staying in the room! Then the second room they gave me was ok at first, then at night when I was trying to fall a sleep...guess what I found....3 BED BUGS on the pillow then I saw another 4 BED BUGS on the bed!!! Shocking exprience, I will NEVER EVER staty at another HOLIDAY INN HOTEL anywhere in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: brisbane-chick
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for the 2nd time in 3 years with my partner before going to Las Vegas. It is a lovely, conveniently located hotel, with all modern amenities close to the airport and all popular tourist attractions. We actually took the Lux Bus from LA to Las Vegas and it picked us up right from the hotel. If you are staying in LA for a few days you can also book tours to Hollywood, Disneyland etc from the concierge and they pick you up right from the hotel. There is also a McDonalds right next door which is great for families and those on a budget. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: Carmania
Reviews.Content: My travel agent advised me to book this hotel because of the free breakfast as opposed to a hotel like the Radisson where I wanted to book. But we spent two days in LA and relied on public transport/taxis. If you have a car this hotel is fine, but if you don't then don't stay here if you don't want hassles. The foyer/lobby and the rooms were very nice, the breakfast was adequate but the service wasn't too good. For instance we weren't worded up on the shuttle and we sat at LAX one night for ages because you have to call for them to pick you up from the airport (we weren't told), unlike everywhere else where they run shuttles all the time like Radisson/Hilton etc for instance. Plus the conceirge wasn't too helpful about how we could get to Disneyland for example. The lifts are REALLY slow, but considering that was the only drawback to the actual hotel you can't really complain. And if you do get in a taxi and they have no clue where this is, advise them it is the old Howard Johnson hotel because we had a cab driver take us to the wrong hotel one night. Internet was free so that was a plus. We picked a car up on our last day in LA to drive to Vegas. We'd booked with Hertz and it was just down the road so we walked to the rental company. If you are willing to public transport it around from this hotel, get the shuttle to drop you off at LAX and then catch a (free) bus out of there to the transit interchange out front of the Lot C carpark for places like Santa Monica and if you are going to Disneyland catch one of the shuttles from there (about $15 each one way to Anaheim). Once we got a hang of the system it was fine but my advice is make sure you know the public transport. A 7/11 and Sizzlers is around the corner is you need dinner or have late-night or really early morning jetlag munchies as we did. There is also a giftshop at the hotel which had quite a good range of necessities, lollies/candy and souvenirs. One other thing, when you get off the plane at LAX make sure you jump on the right shuttle. We unwittingly got on the Holiday Inn shuttle and had to take a cab from there to the Holiday Inn Express. All in all a nice, budget hotel and nice rooms with the only drawback for us being the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: BB2_Syd
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a king bed suite. Beware, you have to ring ahead and book the "complimentary" hotel shuttle. We were unaware of this and wasted 30 minutes waiting for a shuttle bus at LAX airport that never arrived. We caught a taxi instead and managed to be compensated for it. Apparently the hotel had just changed it's policy.

Reviews.Title: “Big Improvement”
Reviews.Author: paragie
Reviews.Content: The Howard Johnson by the airport is now a Holiday Inn Express, and after reading the reviews of the previous property, it sounds like the change has been for the best. The place was updated and looks fabulous. The new management has furnished the place very nicely all the amenities that are standard to HIE. Best of all, the service here is terrific. The manager overheard me asking about the free wireless internet when I checked in. He immediately came over and moved me to a different floor to ensure I got a strong signal. Don't worry, they're finishing the wireless internet installation tomorrow. All part of being a month old, I guess.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Los Angeles-LAX Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 8620 Airport Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90045
